sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to Unit 15 of our English learning journey. In this unit, we'll explore the Past Perfect tense, expressed as 'I had done'.

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: This tense is used to describe actions completed before another past action or a specific point in the past. Let's delve into the key concepts.

sections.title: Formation
points: I had finished my work before she arrived.

sections.title: Usage
sections.content: Describe an action completed before another action or a specific point in the past.
points: Provide context for the sequence of events.

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of the Past Perfect tense:

examples.Positive: By the time I arrived, they had already left
examples.Negative: She had read the book before watching the movie
examples.Interrogative: He realized he had forgotten his keys when he reached the door.

sections.title: Time Expression
sections.content: Recognize the importance of time expressions in identifying the sequence of past events.
points: By the time, before, after, already.

sections.title: Common Mistakes
sections.content: Address common mistakes related to the formation and usage of the Past Perfect tense.
points: Incorrect:When I arrived, they had already leave
Correct: When I arrived, they had already left

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, the Past Perfect tense helps us express the sequence of completed actions in the past. Pay attention to the time expressions that indicate the order of events.

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring examples in language learning books and online exercises.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on the Past Perfect tense. Practice using it to convey the chronological order of events in the past, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Happy learning!
